article.paragraph: TheEuropean Free Alliance(EFA) is aEuropean political party.

It consists of variousRegionalism (politics)regionalistcite bookMarion DemossierThe European Puzzle: The Political Structuring of Cultural Identities at a Time of Transitionhttp://books.google.com/books?id15 August 2007Berghahn Books978-0-85745-863-6152–cite bookElizabeth BombergJohn PetersonRichard CorbettThe European Union: How Does it Work?http://books.google.com/books?id2012Oxford University Press978-0-19-957080-5155–political parties in Europe advocating either full politicalindependenceandsovereignty, or some form ofdevolutionorself-governancefor their country or region.cite webhttp://www.e-f-a.org/about-us/whats-efa-and-history/What's EFA and history26 August 2015The alliance has generally limited its membership to progressive parties,CitationGuptaDevashreeNationalism Across Borders: Transnational Nationalist Advocacy in the European UnionComparative European Politics6661200810.1057/palgrave.cep.6110127therefore only a minority among European regionalist parties are members of the EFA.

Since 1999 the EFA and theEuropean Green Party(EGP) have joined forces withinThe GreensEuropean Free Alliance(Greens/EFA)Political groups of the European Parliamentgroupin theEuropean Parliament, albeit some EFA members have joined other groups from time to time.
The EFA's youth wing is theEuropean Free Alliance Youth(EFAY).
article.heading: History
article.paragraph: Since theEuropean Parliament election, 19791979 election, regionalists have been represented in theEuropean Parliament. Four regionalist parties obtained seats in that election: theScottish National Party(SNP), the FlemishPeople's Union (Belgium)People's Union(VU), the Brussels-basedFdralistes Dmocrates FrancophonesDemocratic Front of Francophones(FDF) and theSouth Tyrolean People's Party(SVP). The SNP, although being predominantlysocial democracysocial-democratic, joined theEuropean Progressive Democrats, aconservatismconservativegroup led by the FrenchGaullismGaullistRally for the Republic. The VU and the FDF joined the heterogeneousTechnical Group of Independents (197984)Technical Group of Independents, while the SVP joined theEuropean People's Party (European Parliament group)European People's Party.cite webWolfram Nordsieckhttp://www.parties-and-elections.eu/eu-groups1979.htmlParties and Elections in EuropeParties-and-elections.eu10 May 2014

In 1981 six parties (VU, theFrisian National Party,Independent Fianna Fil, theParty of German-speaking Belgians, theParty for the Organization of a Free Brittanyand theAlsace-Lorraine National Association), plus three observers (theUnion of the Corsican People, theOccitan Partyand theDemocratic Convergence of Catalonia, CDC), joined forces to form theEuropean Free Alliance.http://www.e-f-a.org/fileadmin/user_upload/documents/3.4.4.3_EFA-THE-INTERNATIONALISM.pdfcite bookAndrew C. GouldAnthony M. MessinaEurope's Contending Identities: Supranationalism, Ethnoregionalism, Religion, and New Nationalismhttp://books.google.com/books?id17 February 2014Cambridge University Press978-1-107-03633-8132–Regionalist MEPs continued, however, to sit in different groups in the European Parliament: the SNP in the Gaullist-dominatedEuropean Democratic Alliance; the VU, theSardinian Action Party(PSd'Az) andEusko AlkartasunaBasque Solidarity(EA) in theRainbow Group (198489)Rainbow Group, together with Green parties; the SVP in theEuropean People's Party (parliamentary group)European People's Party group; the CDC with theEuropean Liberal Democrat and Reform Party (European Parliament group)Liberal Democrats; andBatasunaamongNon-Inscrits.cite webWolfram Nordsieckhttp://www.parties-and-elections.eu/eu-groups1984.htmlParties and Elections in EuropeParties-and-elections.eu20 October 2013

Only after theEuropean Parliament election, 19891989 European Parliament electiondid EFA members form a united group, calledRainbow Group (198994)Rainbowlike its green predecessor. It consisted of three Italian MEPs (two forLega Lombardaand one for the PSd'Az), two Spanish MEPs (one each for the PNV and theAndalusian Party, PA), one Belgian MEP (for VU), one French MEP (Union of the Corsican People, UPC), one British MEP (SNP) and one independent MEP from Ireland. They were joined by 4 MEPs from the Danish left-wing EuroscepticPeople's Movement against the EU, while the other regionalist parties, including the SVP, Batasuna and theConvergence and UnionConvergence and Union of Catalonia(CiU) declined to join.cite webWolfram Nordsieckhttp://www.parties-and-elections.eu/eu-groups1989.htmlParties and Elections in EuropeParties-and-elections.eu20 October 2013

In theEuropean Parliament election, 19941994 European Parliament electionthe regionalists lost many seats. Moreover, the EFA had suspended its major affiliate,Lega Nord, for having joined forces in government with the post-fascistNational Alliance (Italy)National Alliance. Also, the PNV chose to switch to theEuropean People's Party(EPP). The three remaining EFA MEPs (representing the SNP, the VU and theCanarian Coalition) formed a group with the FrenchRadical Party of the Leftnergie Radicalelist and the ItalianPannella List: theEuropean Radical Alliance.cite webWolfram Nordsieckhttp://www.parties-and-elections.eu/eu-groups1994.htmlParties and Elections in EuropeParties-and-elections.eu20 October 2013

Following theEuropean Parliament election, 19991999 European Parliament election, in which EFA parties did quite well, EFA elected MEPs formed a joint group with theEuropean Green Party, under the nameThe GreensEuropean Free Alliance(Greens/EFA). In the event the EFA supplied ten members: two each from the Scottish SNP, the WelshPlaid Cymru, and the Flemish VU, and one each from the Basque PNV and EA, the Andalusian PA and theGalician Nationalist Bloc(BNG).cite webWolfram Nordsieckhttp://www.parties-and-elections.eu/eu-groups1999.htmlParties and Elections in EuropeParties-and-elections.eu20 October 2013

In theEuropean Parliament election, 20042004 European Parliament election, the EFA, which had formally become aEuropean political party,cite webWolfram Nordsieckhttp://www.parties-and-elections.eu/eu-groups2004.htmlParties and Elections in EuropeParties-and-elections.eu20 October 2013was reduced to four MEPs: two from the SNP (Ian HudghtonandAlyn Smith), one fromPlaid Cymru(Jill Evans) and one from theRepublican Left of Catalonia(ERC;Bernat Joan i Mar, replaced at the mid-term by MEPMikel Irujoof the Basque EA). They were joined by two associate members:Tatjana danokaofLatvian Russian UnionFor Human Rights in United Latvia(PCTVL) andLszl Tks, an independent MEP and former member of theDemocratic Union of Hungarians in Romania(UMDR). Co-operation between the EFA and the Greens continued.

Following the 2008 revision of the EU Regulation that governs European political parties allowing the creation ofPolitical foundation at European levelEuropean foundationsaffiliated to European political parties, the EFA established its official foundation/think tank, theCentre Maurits Coppieters(CMC), in September 2007.cite webhttp://www.ideasforeurope.euCentre Maurits Coppieters (CMC) - Ideas for EuropeIdeasforeurope.eu20 October 2013

In theEuropean Parliament election, 20092009 European Parliament election, six MEPs were returned for the EFA: two from the SNP (Ian Hudghton and Alyn Smith), one from Plaid Cymru (Jill Evans), one from theParty of the Corsican Nation(PNC;Franois Alfonsi), one from the ERC (Oriol Junqueras i Vies), and Tatjana danoka, an individual member of the EFA from Latvia. After the election, theNew Flemish Alliance(N-VA) also joined the EFA. The EFA subgroup thus counted seven MEPs.cite webWolfram Nordsieckhttp://www.parties-and-elections.eu/eu-groups2009.htmlParties and Elections in EuropeParties-and-elections.eu10 May 2014

In theEuropean Parliament election, 20142014 European Parliament election, EFA-affiliated parties returned twelve seats to the Parliament: four for the N-VA, two for the SNP, two forL'Esquerra pel Dret a Decidir(an electoral list primarily composed of the ERC), one forThe Peoples DecideLos Pueblos Deciden(an electoral list maily comprisingEH Bildu, a Basque coalition including EA), one forPrimavera Europea(an electoral list comprising theValencian Nationalist Bloc, BNV, and theChunta AragonesistaAragonese Union, ChA), one from Plaid Cymru, and one from theLatvian Russian Union(LKS). Due to ideological divergences with the FlemishGroen (political party)Greens,cite webhttp://www.euractiv.com/sections/eu-elections-2014/will-flemish-separatists-save-tories-europe-302068Will Flemish separatists save the Tories in Europe?EurActiv - EU News & policy debates, across languages26 August 2015the N-VA defected to theEuropean Conservatives and Reformists(ECR) groupcite webhttp://www.standaard.be/cnt/dmf20140618_01146790 N-VA kiest voor ECR-fractie in Europees ParlementJohanVan Overtveldt2014-06-18standaard.beDutchN-VA chooses ECR Group in the European Parliament2014-06-18cite webhttp://www.flanderstoday.eu/politics/n-va-joins-ecr-group-european-parliamentN-VA joins ECR group in European Parliament26 August 2015and the EH Bildu MEP joined theEuropean United LeftNordic Green Left(GUE/NGL) group: the EFA representation within the Greens/EFA group was thus of seven MEPs.cite webhttp://www.greens-efa.eu/up-to-date-list-of-the-meps-for-the-new-legislative-period-12490.htmlUp-to-date list of the MEPs for the new legislative period26 August 2015
article.heading: Ideology
article.paragraph: In the Brussels declaration of 2000 the EFA codified its political principles. The EFA stands for "a Europe of Free Peoples based on the principle ofsubsidiarity, which believe in solidarity with each other and the peoples of the world."cite webhttp://www.e-f-a.org/efaactive.php?idEuropean Free AllianceE-f-a.org10 May 2014The EFA sees itself as an alliance ofStatelessnessstatelesspeoples, which are striving towards independence, autonomy, recognition or wanting a proper voice in Europe. It supports European integration on basis of the subsidiarity-principle. It believes also that Europe should move away from further centralisation and works towards the formation of a "Europe of regions". It believes that regions should have more power in Europe, for instance participating in theCouncil of the European Union, when matters within theirJurisdictioncompetenceare discussed. It also wants to protect thelanguages of the European Unionlinguisticand cultural diversity within the EU.

The EFA broadly stands on theleft-wing politicsleft-wingof the political spectrum. The Brussels declaration emphasises the protection ofhuman rights,sustainable developmentandsocial justice. In 2007 the EFA congress inBilbaoadded several progressive principles to the declaration, including a commitment to fight againstracism,antisemitism,discrimination,xenophobiaandislamophobia, and a commitment to get fullcitizenshipforimmigrationimmigrants, includingsuffragevoting rights.

EFA members are generallyprogressivismprogressive, although there are some notable exceptions as the conservativeNew Flemish Alliance,Bavaria Party,Schleswig PartyandFuture of land, the Christian-democraticSlovene Union, the centre-rightLiga Veneta Repubblicaand the far-rightcite webhttp://www.corriere.it/editoriali/09_maggio_08/editoriale_alto_adige_ernesto_galli_della_loggia_fb5d76a4-3b8e-11de-a872-00144f02aabc.shtmlI separati dell’Alto Adige - Corriere della SeraCorriere.it10 May 2014cite webhttp://ricerca.gelocal.it/altoadige/archivio/altoadige/2010/10/14/AZBPO_AZB03.htmlDigos e carabinieri nella sede del partito - Alto Adige dal 2004.it » RicercaRicerca.gelocal.it14 October 201010 May 2014cite webhttp://altoadige.gelocal.it/cronaca/2011/10/03/news/frattini-denuncia-il-diario-della-klotz-1.4288768Frattini denuncia il "diario" della Klotz - Cronaca - Alto AdigeAltoadige.gelocal.it24 July 201210 May 2014cite webhttp://www.lastampa.it/2011/10/04/italia/cronache/nel-diario-scolastico-sudtirolesei-terroristi-si-scoprono-eroi-39Rsc1svaFlvWfi53OBIBJ/pagina.htmlLa Stampa - Nel diario scolastico sudtirolesei terroristi si scoprono eroiLastampa.it10 May 2014South Tyrolean Freedom.
article.heading: Organisation
article.paragraph: The main organs of the EFA organisation are the General Assembly, the Bureau and the Secretariat.
article.heading: General Assembly
article.paragraph: In the General Assembly, the supreme council of the EFA, every member party has one vote.
article.heading: Bureau and Secretariat
article.paragraph: The Bureau takes care of daily affairs. It is chaired byFranois Alfonsi(Party of the Corsican Nation), president of the EFA, whileJordi Sol(Republican Left of Catalonia) is secretary-general andLorena Lopez de Lacalle(Eusko AlkartasunaBasque Solidarity) treasurer and vice-president. The Bureau is completed by other nine vice-presidents:Gustave Alirol(Occitan Party),Olrik Bouma(Frisian National Party),Fabrizio Comencini(Liga Veneta Repubblica),Eric Defoort(New Flemish Alliance),Jill Evans(Plaid Cymru),Ian Hudghton(Scottish National Party),Davyth Hicks(Mebyon Kernow),Axel Jonsson(Future of land) andAna Miranda (politician)Ana Miranda(Galician Nationalist Bloc).cite webhttp://www.e-f-a.org/whos-who/members-of-the-bureau/Members of the BureauEuropean Free ALliance22 April 2015

article.heading: Full members
article.paragraph: RefimprovesectionMay 2014Before becoming a member party, an organization needs to have been an observer of the EFA for at least one year. Only one member party per region is allowed. If a second party from a region wants to join the EFA, the first party needs to agree, at which point these two parties will then form a common delegation with one vote. The EFA also recognises friends of the EFA, a special status for regionalist parties outside of the European Union.
